discourse_list.title: Polls to determine specific Black Thurs vault compensation

content.content: @MakerMan posted his liquidation report. We need to write the on-chain polls to translate these data into a specific compensation level. In my opinion, there are too many options to efficiently decide using the current polling system. We really need rank-choice voting. Fortunately, @Derek Flossman predicted that rank-choice voting will be available by mid next week. Therefore, I propose two polls:  Pick a cell from Table 8. Let’s pick row from the 1.13 column. Every row will be a poll option (plus an option for zero compensation) Which DAI daily price do we use for ETH/BAT? Options: today’s price, Black Thursday’s price, or an average of today’s and Black Thursday’s price  Does this cover all the options that people want to vote on? Should the polls be conducted in a particular order or simultaneously?
content.GPT-summary: The author proposes two polls to determine specific Black Thurs vault compensation and asks for feedback on whether the options cover all that people want to vote on and whether the polls should be conducted in a particular order or simultaneously. A 3rd party could give constructive criticism or ask questions about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: psychonaut:  Let’s pick row from the 1.13 column   Personally I’d prefer to use the “All / 1.14” column to make sure we don’t exclude any vaults that received less than the agreed target collateral return rate.     psychonaut:  Options: today’s price, Black Thursday’s price, or an average of today’s and Black Thursday’s price   Also I think that instead of “today’s price” it could be “price at time compensation is made available”.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None
None

content.content: monet-supply:  Also I think that instead of “today’s price” it could be “price at time compensation is made available”   After further pondering, we should probably just pick an actual specific date when we write the poll to eliminate ambiguity.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
None
None

content.content: psychonaut:  Should the polls be conducted in a particular order or simultaneously?   I propose we run poll #2 first.

I see 1,5,8,9,10,11,12,13,15,20,25 all as % options on that table. I would disregard 25% and make it 24.67%. Additional important collateral percentages for taking into account might also include: 24.670%  - maximum theoretical compensation ‭21.185‬%  - the mid point between maximum compensation and PreBT average 17.700%  - the average amount of collateral vault holders were left with before 0 bid auctions allowed Re: Option 2 poll @monet-supply pointed out “price of time compensation is made available” Could there perhaps be an option to set the DAI price of compensation to the ETH/BAT exchange rate at a fixed hour like 00:00 UTC on the day compensation is scheduled? If that were to be consensus that would allow for compensation to be made in DAI that would equate quite closely to the same amount of ETH and BAT that Vault holders lost.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: It’s complicated. My heart says “100% compensation”. My brain says “0% compensation”. If Maker decides to pay compensation I think we could possibly assume some legal responsibility for the outcomes of the Maker system. While we strive for making a robust system there should never be any legal guarantee for this. Note that this should open up a business opportunity for Vault liquedation insurance if anyone is interested.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

Nevermind. After further consideration, I think we’re good to go. I asked @MakerMan to add all the missing rows to Table 8 so we have 1% increments.

@MakerMan, to be fair, vaults like @Vault2288 that self-liquidated should be included as eligible for compensation along with other affected vaults. Can you update Table 8 with these vaults? Can you identify vaults like @Vault2288 or do we need to solicit owners to step forward?

Obviously vault holders would prefer the dollar value in present time since the price of ETH has roughly doubled. If we refund in ETH/BAT then the mechanics become much more complex while the difference in compensation value is negligible. Do you advocate for compensation using ETH/BAT for some reason??

NikKunkel:  These values are all interconnected no?   Yes, but how can we run a single poll that answers both the reference price date question and the percent collateral returned question at the same time?

content.content: I think I’ve come around to your proposed sequence in light of not being able to come up with an alternative.

I can start adding the vault holders that step forward as a class.   Vault2288 is pretty unique because the audit trail is pretty clean.    What I want to see is ETH before and ETH after so we can see their collateral return percentage since we are using this as the primary discriminator for compensation. Vault 2288 returned 585.18 on 5005ETH or collateral return 11.6919%  I have looked at his audit trail but not verified it entirely.   It took him a while to get the data out of defisaver so he knew how much ETH came back from his 5005ETH in his vault before Black Thursday. I really want these people to step up themselves and provide their own verifiable audit trail. BTW:   Here is the 1.14 column you wanted broken down by %.   I see a slight difference (no more than .02ETH) from report.  I was re-establishing formulas to make sure certain lines were intact and saw this a very slight change in numbers. 1%	1125.21 2%	2250.41 3%	3376.08 4%	4530.08 5%	5694.70 6%	6868.85 7%	8083.00 8%	9312.78 9%	10551.40 10%	11796.35 11%	13048.64 12%	14308.02 13%	15575.06 14%	16858.14 15%	18171.76 16%	19495.66 17%	20860.15 18%	22231.58 19%	23603.22 20%	24978.50 21%	26367.80 22%	27765.89 23%	29189.14 24%	30617.51 25%	32047.09

content.content: @Derek Any update on rank-choice voting?

Hi Joshua, development is complete and I am running through a few final tests to make sure everything is as expected. Some screenshots in the meantime: User ability to submit multiple candidates/values. Subsequent available values can be added with the “add another choice” link. The vote once submitted will then show as current vote.  Screenshot 2020-05-07 at 17.33.521149×440 21.4 KB  Progress will be shown in the format of a bar chart. The bar chart will surface green for 1st choice votes and grey for secondary choices that push that value up in ranking (not shown below) to determine the leader.

content.content: This poll thread is still significantly deviating from the signalling guidelines. Can you please take a another look at them and follow the steps for any future polls? I’m also putting this poll on hold until the following issues can be debated and/or addressed: General Issues: I had no idea that this thread had morphed into another on chain poll. There was no signal tag, no forum poll, no proposed poll content and a shockingly low amount of engagement from the people who are presumably most interested in this issue. And it also appears that the planning silently moved into github again so there is no content of the onchain poll for people to view. Having the content of the poll change in another tool without notifying the thread here does not feel like consensus to me. Some specific issues:   The language of the poll itself makes an alarming declaration: “Maker is only responsible for auction failures…”  Who is Maker in that sentence? Who has the authority to make such a claim on behalf of the ecosystem?    It lists arguments for two of the options but not the third.   What happens if the price of ETH goes down significantly before the contract is created?   The inclusion of arguments unavoidably includes bias. Why is there editorialising in the body of a poll? Why doesn’t it just link back to this forum thread where the debate was supposed to have happened?   Why is CMC used as a price reference? It is legendarily inaccurate and makes no distinction between wash-trading exchanges and legitimate ones.  What utility does price info have here at all? I can’t see how it is relevant to the question at hand other than to provide an easy way for people to calculate how much more would be available if one option is chosen over another. That feels tangential to the question at hand doesn’t it?    I went over the reasons why the signalling guidelines are important in great detail in the last poll and unfortunately my issues still stand. I realise that this will be disappointing for some but (even though I consider the community’s self organization around this issue to be one of the coolest things I’ve seen in governance yet) I’m going to hold off on posting this one for Monday until we can discuss the above concerns.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: @rich.brown Hi Richard, so how much longer is the community going to be left hanging if the poll isn’t being allowed by you to go live? I firmly disagree with you that there is “low engagement by people most interested in this issue”. Myself and many others have been very vocal as seen here:     Black Thursday Vault owners report Thread Collateral Discussion       This thread is for vault owners that want to come - or anyone really and pretty much make entries like Vault NNNNN - Comments  to present their Black Thursday loss post mortem event.  This thread is simply about accumulating individual vault data so the full picture can emerge of the event and potentially a claims submission place for individual vault holders.  I know that everyone at Maker wants to express sincere apologies for any misunderstandings as well as actual losses during this event, w…         Maker MCD Ethereum System Liquidation report and Black Thursday Compensation Analysis Governance       One last thing folks.  I am just working to clean up my spreadsheet and remove superfluous data before posting the data here for people to download and work with themselves.  I have Twicky working on another dataset but did not put a rush on this.  My goal is to post the current ETH-A dataset in hand by next weekend (I am working 52hrs this week and have a family with 1yr 5yr old to take care of).   Also while I have been compensated for my work on the initial report and I am paying out of those…     One benefit I can see here however, is running the 2 polls necessary at the same time. I would propose merging the 2 polls into the same voting process. Poll 1: Vault Compensation Reference Price Date Poll Poll 2: Percentage Of Vault Collateral To Be Returned To Black Thursday Victims So there would be 2 separate polls live at the same time. This way it can be done all at once and steps can be made to proceed from there. Re: your concern for visibility -  could you offer the solution to this then by making a very visible sticky thread for creating discourse for the above two polls and how options should look? I’m sure myself and many others would appreciate the place for that to happen if the current threads by your standards aren’t the place for that to take place. The longer this drags out the more I lose complete confidence in the MakerDAO system. The auctions are very flawed and has caused much higher than necessary losses to those involved.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Vault2288:  Hi Richard, so how much longer is the community going to be left hanging if the poll isn’t being allowed by you to go live?   Hi @Vault2288, the community will be left hanging by precisely the amount of time it takes the community to organize itself around a cohesive plan or show a willingness to follow the signalling guidelines like all of the other polls.     Vault2288:  I firmly disagree with you that there is “low engagement by people most interested in this issue”.   You’ve posted in this thread twice, a few other other non-aligned people are represented, and then 13 posts by @psychonaut.  That is not representative of the 300 or so people affected by the issue or of the number of people who spoke up in other threads.     Vault2288:  One benefit I can see here however, is running the 2 polls necessary at the same time.   It’s something you will have to organize with the people involved with this initiative.     Vault2288:  Re: your concern for visibility - could you offer the solution to this then by making a very visible sticky thread for creating discourse for the above two polls and how options should look?   Once the polls are created, sure.     Vault2288:  I’m sure myself and many others would appreciate the place for that to happen if the current threads by your standards aren’t the place for that to take place   It has nothing to do with my standards. My role is to ensure that the community’s standards are being followed. They are outlined in the signaling guidelines thread.

content.content: Edit, LFW: Moved from Covid Crash: Emergency Governance Summary as it is more on-topic here. Great write-up @LongForWisdom I would like to share what is very much on my mind. I think now that the dust has settled there should be more forward efforts in proceeding promptly with compensation for vault holders to help restore some positive integrity and reputation to the MakerDAO system and also to have some compassion for those involved as there are many. Being left with 0% of collateral after liquidation is an enormous difference between the PreBlackThursday average of 17.7%. @MakerMan  has spoken of a working group and it would be good to get some more details on this. I was actually just thinking about setting up a Discord Server for communications and being able to co-ordinate efforts although I’m not sure if that is something others feel would be useful? @psychonaut has come up with some good ideas in terms of structuring how a compensation by way of governance votes could look. Primarily this consists of running 2 polls. These are (does not by any means have to follow this exact wording) but along these lines: Poll 1: Vault Compensation Reference Price Date Poll (Already on Github as a PR)   github.com/makerdao/community         Vault Compensation Reference Price Date Poll, initial draft   makerdao:master ← jpritikin:blackthur            opened 06:38PM - 01 May 20 UTC               jpritikin             +59 -0            This is to establish on behalf of the community which the community can use to signal which date to use for ETH/BAT references prices vs DAI for vault compensation. This is because it has been established it would easier to compensate in DAI.  Poll 2: Percentage Of Vault Collateral To Be Returned To Black Thursday Victims (Yet to be added as PR)  This is to establish on behalf of the community which the community can use to signal which % of collateral effected vaults should have returned to them in DAI equivalent.  – Richard has pointed out today that Poll 1 does not meet the following Signaling Guidelines I believe it should be a priority to complete both Poll 1 and Poll 2 outlines on Github as pull requests and have both meeting this requirement of the above guidelines. Once this is achieved both polls can be added to the Voting/Polling dashboard and be ran simultaneously to finally be able to decide the terms for community compensation for vault holders. This has taken longer than necessary and we should be as a community doing everything we can to restore the confidence and reputation of MakerDAO, and not let the efforts so far made be in any vein.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Vault2288:  So there would be 2 separate polls live at the same time.   I don’t think this is feasible. The polls are interdependent. As votes favor one choice on one poll this will affect the probabilities of votes on the other poll and vice versa. I ask that you please reconsider your suggestion to run both polls simultaneously. Once we know the reference price date then we can decide on the percent auction return.

rich.brown:   The language of the poll itself makes an alarming declaration: “Maker is only responsible for auction failures…”  Who is Maker in that sentence? Who has the authority to make such a claim on behalf of the ecosystem?    Please suggest improved language. In writing that, I was trying to identify the entity that may provide vault compensation.     rich.brown:   It lists arguments for two of the options but not the third.    The third is a compromise. If you think it needs arguments, please suggest some.     rich.brown:   What happens if the price of ETH goes down significantly before the contract is created?    That’s why I put example calculations in the poll. You can figure it out. If MKR holders choose M13 then nothing changes. If MKR holders choose the current price of the assets then that’s what will be used.     rich.brown:   The inclusion of arguments unavoidably includes bias. Why is there editorialising in the body of a poll? Why doesn’t it just link back to this forum thread where the debate was supposed to have happened?    The April 6 poll included arguments. If you prefer to keep arguments outside the poll then I am okay with that, but I need to know how to format the poll so we can get this done promptly.     rich.brown:   Why is CMC used as a price reference? It is legendarily inaccurate and makes no distinction between wash-trading exchanges and legitimate ones.    I don’t have a strong preference. I figured even CMC can provide daily high/low price, but I’m happy to use your preferred price data. Please suggest something.     rich.brown:   What utility does price info have here at all? I can’t see how it is relevant to the question at hand other than to provide an easy way for people to calculate how much more would be available if one option is chosen over another. That feels tangential to the question at hand doesn’t it?    I’m really confused. How is it tangential? We need to determine how to calculate the amount of compensation. How do you propose we do it?
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
Author of proposal is explaining proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: @psychonaut See your point about it being interdependent. It’s a formula with 2 parameters. The formula is reference price * auction% So really we first need to know the price date being used before voting on the auction% to return in order to better understand the amount required for compensation in advance.

content.content: make_dao_2020:  What necessary data is missing?   I would like to know this also.     make_dao_2020:  Maybe the vault owners can submit their proof?   Agreed if an on-chain audit trail can be produced I don’t see why this class can’t be included.     make_dao_2020:  I don’t have much knowledge about the self-liquidated vaults.   Self-liquidated vaults actually reduced the amount of bad debt in the system that was already paid for by MKR token holders. I was seeing the 0 bid auctions in real-time and it made no sense to sit and wait losing 100%. In short it ended up saving MKR token holders from having to fork out more to cover the shortfall by not incurring further bad debt in the system. – If 0 bid vaults are being compensated, self liquidating vaults who actually did more to help the protocol should be compensated so they are no worse off than those who are compensated from 0 bids. They should at least get the difference between what was received as a self-liquidated vault and what is distributed to vaults who came under the liquidation gun. Example: If compensation for 0 bid vaults is 17.7% At a minimum a self-liquidating vault that received 12% - should be eligible to receive the difference as compensation. I don’t see how it’s complicated with the onchain data. I will post mine again for reference.   docs.google.com    Copy of 0x261B003777C2797aCa986e9B2c3485C5511863Cd 0x261B003777C2797aCa986e9B2c3485C5511863Cd  _id,status,address,txHash,title,category,added,__v,mined,minedBlock ObjectId("5e6acefddf27fd2e189dc73f"),confirmed,0x261b003777c2797aca986e9b2c3485c5511863cd,<a...

content.content: The_Ratj:  Should it simply be a matter of compensating any Vault holders who come forth to the forums and have a proveable case, but then not worrying about any other self liquidators who do not come forth within a certain time frame?   This is an option, but there’s a risk of excluding certain users e.g. non-english speakers who aren’t able to claim via the forums. The bigger concern for me is compensating vaults based on a “nominal percentage return” of collateral may not address all vaults who self-liquidated or paid back debt on black thursday. For example, what if a vault owner had repaid all or part of their vault’s outstanding DAI debt on black thursday to avoid liquidation, but had purchased the DAI with outside funds that were not collateral for their vault? It’s not clear how we would judge how much of their collateral they had already gotten back vs how much more they should be compensated.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party asking questions about proposal

content.content: Are there many of these cases? No. Is there a timeline we can sort these things out? No. It’s very hard to get a scientifically “fair” number for all these accounts. In the end, we may have to under-compensate or over-compensate those self-liquidated ones. I think it’s understandable and much better than delaying everything forever.

content.content: The class action lawsuit specifically mentions failed auctions. To me, this suggests that we should proceed with compensation of vault holders who were affected by failed auctions (the same parties).

content.content: Self-liquidated vaults are also effected by failed auctions however - and shouldn’t have to wait longer to be compensated the difference, considering it’s that easy. I am not understanding why those in this situation should be made to wait when it can be done at the same time.

content.content: Folks, I am in the middle of a 52hr work week, and dealing with a lot so I slow down for 7 days before I can pick up again. Everyone is annoyed with how slowly this is going.   The one main problem that is sticking us is the idea that if we try to piecemeal this a few things will happen:  governance pleasure will run out - quickly.   We want the first hit on this to potentially cover everyone. If we don’t try to hit everyone out of the gate. people will be left out.  Put simply we want to do this, quickly, but also correctly in a way that is fair and equitable (as much as governance pleasure will allow).    Anything else and we end up with a worse mess of some people getting something, others nothing, and everyone madder than before because there is nothing worse than dangling a carrot and taking it away. I started a new thread where everyone can look for Maker Vault Compensation Status Updates.     Maker Vault Compensation Updates and Status Governance       Greetings everyone.  I am starting this thread to have a single place for Updates on the above.   I will edit here so people can see the current status and items yet to be worked on.  My time is limited and LongForWisdom is a much better forum organizer so bear with me.  WORKING GROUP consists of @Joshua_Pritikin @LongForWisdom @MakerMan @monet-supply @Vault2288  20200521 Status Update  While working on a comprehensive compensation plan we discovered there are more classes of people affected by …     I can’t speak for the current working group here, but it is my impression from the group it would be cleaner from a governance perspective, and very important with our first compensation plan to sweep as wide as possible.  The goal is to attempt to satisfy all concerned parties and do this in a simpler fashion for governance to deal with.   We know everyone we offer compsation to won’t accept and we also know governance will want a firm maximum pricetag on all of this otherwise they will likely not act.   I know everyone on all sides wants a fast, clean closure on this, at least the best we can. Right now working group has a good idea of a plan but we need the above data to use as input into a new compensation report (which ‘should’ be relatively easy to construct as the data is simpler in some sense) that characterizes compensation across ALL possible classes and allows governance to vote on a single total that can be raised and used to fund compensation. I am personally sorry this isn’t going faster and can only offer my own personal apologies as the working group is trying to act to drive this without a real governance mandate and funds provided by governance to complete the task.  It is like trying to run a division of a company without a formal head, a goal, or funds to achieve it.   So we literally are flying by the seats of our pants using our own funds and resources and personal perserverance to move this forward. I can only speak for myself and not governance.   Sincerest apologies the DAO wasn’t really on top of this in the way a CEX could.   I honestly am at a loss for why I am apologizing to vault owners except that I feel it is correct.  I look at each of the liquidations and think - this is a person and even doing the first report was saddening to me personally.   I know everyone involved with Maker wants to see this resolved quickly and equitably for all parties concerned.
